AstroObjectEntry:
GIANTS_DEEP
SCROLL_WORKSHOP Scroll and Stone Workshop STOWAWAYS
Workshop R1 TH_CAMPSITE The construction of the Sanctuary used a new type of projection stone crafted at a workshop on Giant's Deep.
Workshop R2 Projection stones for the Orbital Probe Cannon were crafted at a workshop on Statue Island.
Workshop R3 GD_STATUE_ISLAND Nomai using the voyager stones noticed their voyagers arriving outside the projection pool, and received visions from other voyages.
Workshop R4 A new type of projection stone used the memory statues' memory storage systems to allow paired Nomai to explore remotely beyond projection pools.
Workshop EX1 This workshop on Giant's Deep was where Nomai scrolls and projection stones were crafted.
Workshop EX2 A new type of projection stone allowed Nomai to explore remotely beyond projection pools, granting them imperviousness to most hazards.
A new type of projection stone used memory storage systems to allow Nomai to explore remotely beyond projection pools, granting them imperviousness to most hazards. Workshop R4
Workshop EX3 Conversations shared across projection stones are not stored on the stones themselves, but on the projection walls they were written on, which can only be read with the corresponding projection stones.
Workshop EX4 Up to one voyager per memory mask can remain on standby when disconnected, returning a voyage to its position when reconnected.
Workshop EX5 Voyaging to the same destination from the same projection pool can cause connection to a voyager waiting on standby connected to another memory mask, sharing the voyage with them.
Workshop EX6 A Nomai named Daz was cut off while writing to the Deep Storm Station from the Scroll and Stone Workshop.
///
BISLE_STUDY Backshore Study Site NONE
Study R1 Jellyfish Study Site A group of Nomai discovered frozen jellyfish on this island. They decided to find higher elevation to be safe from the waves while studying them.
Study EX1 A shore on Bramble Island high enough to be safe from waves, where Nomai studied frozen jellyfish.
Study EX2 The Nomai transported a frozen jellyfish from this island back to the Looming City to investigate why they had stopped coming to the surface of the ocean.
Study EX3 Nomai noticed the planet becoming completely dark, before what appeared to be a giant column of water launched the island into space.
Study EX4 Gabbro slept at this camp and woke up to find a cyclone had lifted the island into space. (He got soaked, but was otherwise fine.)
///
PIONEER_BEACH Pioneers' Beach None
Pioneer R1
I found a mural of what appears to be Nomai observing jellyfish on the surface of the ocean.
Pioneer EX1 This camp on Statue Island's shores sheltered Nomai during their first survey expedition to Giant's Deep.
Pioneer EX2 The expedition team moved their supplies into the island's interior for shelter.
Pioneer EX3 A Nomai named Melorae stressed the importance of protecting themselves from cyclones, or seeking a landmass clear of their path entirely.
Pioneer EX4 The Nomai discovered a species of tentacled lifeforms on the surface of Giant's Deep.
The Nomai discovered jellyfish on the surface of Giant's Deep. Pioneer R1
///
CONSTRUCT_BAY Construction Bay STOWAWAYS
CB_EX1 A bay on the opposite side of the Construction Yard flooded by ghost matter.
CB_EX2A I found schematics for something called the Orbital Probe Cannon.
CB_EX2 I found schematics for something called the Inspired.
CB_EX3 A Nomai named Cassava noticed storm shelters on the island powering on by themselves, even in the absence of cyclones.
CB_EX4 A Nomai named Cassava observed ghost matter being temporarily neutralized by water. He concluded that ghost matter could not penetrate water.
CB_EX5 The Nomai excavated the core of Giant's Deep to construct the Deep Storm Station. They asked Nomai at the Construction Yard to warp in to charge a return warp that would allow them to return them to the surface.
///
LOVERSCOVE Lovers' Cove STOWAWAYS
Cove R1 Ghost Matter Cove There is a small cove on Gabbro's Island guarded by ghost matter.
Cove R2 Ghost Matter Cove Gabbro made a second campfire outside this cove, but abandoned it after finding the waves were washing high enough to extinguish it.
Cove R3 Ghost Matter Cove A Nomai named Daz tested a new type of projection stone with a Nomai named Cassava on this island. During this test, his voyager disappeared without warning, to Cassavaâ€™s alarm.
Cove EX1 A small cove inside Gabbro's Island filled with ghost matter.
Cove EX2 A Nomai named Daz proposed to a Nomai named Cassava in this cove! Strangely, Daz appeared to celebrate Cassava's acceptance before even receiving an answer.
Cove EX3 While sharing joyous news of his engagement, Daz revealed that he had proposed to Cassava during a 6-second negative time interval.
Cove EX4 According to a Nomai named Cassava, days last shorter on Gabbro's Island and Statue Island.
Cove EX5 As the sun orbits overhead, its gravity causes waves to wash higher on the island, washing high enough to dissolve voyagers.
LOOMINGCITY Looming City None
LC R1 CONSTRUCT_BAY The Nomai on Giant's Deep used to be completely insulated from cyclones in the Looming City.
LC R2 BISLE_STUDY A Nomai named Thatch proposed transporting a frozen jellyfish back to a habitat in the Looming City for research.
LC R3 BISLE_STUDY A Nomai named Melorae expressed her curiosity about how the jellyfish would interact with the quantum shard in the Looming City.
LC R4 The Nomai abandoned this tower after a quantum shard invaded and caused its interior to become inhospitably quantum.
LC EX1 A great tower that once served as a Nomai settlement, built on an island within the eye of the hurricane.
LC EX2 The Nomai abandoned this tower due to extenuating circumstances, chronicled in scrolls within the tower.
The Nomai abandoned this tower after a quantum shard they uncovered caused its interior to become inhospitably quantum. LC R4
LC EX3 A Nomai named Melorae discovered that quantum objects could be locked in place while observing them through photos. Her apprentice proudly celebrated them as the greatest quantum geologists of their clan.
LC EX4 Objects left on a quantum shard travel with them.
LOOMINGCITY_JELLY Cerberus' Pool None
Jellyfish Habitat 1 LCJ R1 The Nomai constructed a jellyfish habitat at the Looming City to conduct further research into them.
LCJ R2 A Nomai named Solanum lost a scroll in this pool. A jellyfish at the bottom of the pool guards the scroll with its electrifying tentacles.
LCJ EX1 A pool under the Looming City that houses a jellyfish the Nomai studied. A scroll sits at the bottom of the pool, guarded by the jellyfish.
LCJ EX2 The Nomai discovered that jellyfish are drawn to the surface of the ocean by the Quantum Moon's gravity.
LCJ EX3 Giant's Deep's thick clouds completely obscure sight of anything outside the planet.
LCJ EX4 The Quantum Moon Locator on Ember Twin's south pole allows a clear view of which planet the Quantum Moon is orbiting at all times.
DEEP_STORM_STATION Deep Storm Station
STOWAWAYS
Deepest Space DSS Probe My scout was warped somewhere into a space filled with ghost matter. There are glowing masks and wires built into the walls.
DSS R2 Deep Storm Station 1 I was able to enter the Deep Storm Station using a voyager stone. The gravity floor seems to be too strong for me to jump to the other side of the station.
DSS R3 Deep Storm Station 1 Two Nomai named Pye and Idaea tried to warp to the Deep Storm Station, but arrived on Statue Island instead. They returned to Ash Twin to await guidance.
DSS R4 A Nomai named Cassava made a pressing note to himself never to lock the Quantum Moon in orbit around Giant's Deep to protect the native species from ghost matter.
Deep Storm Station 1 CONV R1 TT_TIME_LOOP_DEVICE The Deep Storm Station powered a 6-second negative time interval to test the mechanics of the Ash Twin Project.
Deep Storm Station 1 CONV R2 LOVERSCOVE While sharing joyous news of his engagement, Daz revealed that he had proposed to Cassava during a 6-second negative time interval.
Deep Storm Station 1 CONV R3 GD_CONSTRUCTION_YARD The Nomai excavated the core of Giant's Deep to construct the Deep Storm Station. They asked Nomai at the Construction Yard to warp in to charge a return warp that would allow them to return them to the surface.
Deep Storm Station 1 CONV R4 SCROLL_WORKSHOP A Nomai named Daz was cut off while writing to the Deep Storm Station from the Scroll and Stone Workshop.
DSS EX1 An underwater station built at the heart of Giant's Deep.
An underwater station at the heart of Giant's Deep. Using energy from the planet's electric core, it powered a 6-second negative time interval that tested the mechanics of the Ash Twin Project. CONV R1
DSS EX2 There are eight monoliths with Nomai masks attached. Two of the masks are lit up.
DSS EX3 A Nomai named Cassava was protected from some sort of danger aboard the Deep Storm Station. He used voyager stones to travel outside the station safely.
A Nomai named Cassava survived the arrival of ghost matter in the star system aboard the Deep Storm Station. He used voyager stones to travel outside the station safely. COMET_INTERIOR_X1
DSS EX4 Cassava quarantined the few surviving Hearthians within the Sanctuary upon realizing that the species was gravely endangered by ghost matter.
DSS EX5 Cassava warped all ghost matter captured by the Inspired into the Deep Storm Station to contain it indefinitely, at the cost of his own life.
DSS EX6 A recording in the Deep Storm Station contained Cassava's last words. The Nomai known as Cassava met his end without fear.
